docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A sleekly dressed woman in her 30's thought it odd when the physician she consulted about her frequent headaches asked if she usually tried to hold in her stomach. The resulting muscular tension, he told her, could cause the pain in her head. She has since allowed herself to show a little belly and, much to her surprise, has been virtually headache-free.

headline.main: The Limits on Action by a Public Health Agency

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Following are excerpts from the New York State Court of Appeals decision striking down smoking rules imposed by the Public Health Council. The majority opinion was written by Judge Vito J. Titone and the dissent was written by Judge Joseph W. Bellacosa. MAJORITY OPINION

headline.main: Teen-Age Risk-Taking: Rise in Deaths Prompts New Research Effort

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Alarmed by the rising toll of accidents and violence among teenagers, the Federal Government and private foundations have embarked on a major new program of research on why teen-agers take so many foolish risks - and how such dangerous behavior can be curbed.
